catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 872
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: gray pot stand with wide base funneling into a narrow neck; shallow top for a pot; triangular cutouts in body within wide incised bands; shallow incised zigzagging lines
text: Perforated stoneware such as this stand are associated with the Silla Kingdom and Gaya Confederacy in southeast Korea. The region is peppered with excavation sites, where discoveries continue to be made to this day. This tall stand, which would have supported a smaller dish or jar for storing food or liquid, was probably used in a burial context.
title: Tall stand with perforated base
